Foster, Kenneth Andrew,
Abernethy, Sask. 1887.
PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire:

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual has lived exactly the same experiences as another. Some of these questions answer will not apply to your experience; others may be impossible for you to answer so do not worry if you cannot answer them. You may feel free to give details or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires:

Western Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Past: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Eat?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ) and one will be sent to you.

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you will be willing to answer.

All Questionnaire Areas:

- Pioneer health conditions
- Pioneer schooling, life, sports and recreation
- Pioneer education and churchwork
- Pioneer family experiences

Preservation of Questionnaires:

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.
PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A work of exploration into the pioneer experiences of Kenneth Foster.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions herein will not apply to your experience but others may prove useful. If so, please answer them. If not, please leave them blank.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

OTHER QUESTIONNAIRES

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Life: What Did We Need?", is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ). It will be sent to you.

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

- All questionnaires concerning:
  - Pioneer health conditions
  - Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
  - Pioneer education and churchwork
  - Pioneer farming experiences

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent records of our province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Division,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.
